comment: His accent is pretty thick, you must study ahead and do the homework from the book. Quizzes are the same problems from the homework assignments. It is a very tedious class, lucky I met my Chinese friend to help me make an A. He is very clear about grading, and he gave us an amazingly clear outlinereview for the 3 exams. He's not bad. Attendgrade
He does not speak a clear English. He always taking to a count of personalization for grading. He just cant teach
Great professor. He explains the material very clearly and really wants everyone to make a good grade in the class. His tests aren't easy but if you do the homework you will do fine.
Great teacher. Homework and attendance are a over weighted when it comes to your grade, but other than that, very fair.

He definitely knows his stuff, but its hard for him to explain the material. His examples are very basic, so you don't know what to do when you come across more complicated examples. It is necessary to use his office hours to get clarity on the units, and try using the ATTIC for extra help as well. You can pass the class with strong dedication.
He is ok. If you pay attention or do the homework you should be fine. He has a deep accent but he explains very well mathematically. Only thing I hate about his class is the quizzes.

Teacher is concise to sticking to his schedule and has a great understanding of Discrete Mathematics. He teaches very clearly and homework is even optional (although, do it for the practice). He always has a 10% extra credit for his exams and is very nice. Not a very strong English accent, but he will try to push past that barrier.
Prof Taixi Xu is a good professor, if you do the homework and the practice tests, the test will be a piece of cake.

Took him for Diff EQ. Make sure you understand the homework well, quizs and tests are passable. Gives extra credit @ end of each test but very difficult. Decent grading style, although I could only understand about 20% of what he said, his work on the board is very clear. Don't under estimate this class. It's tough. Put the time in, do Homework!

I took him for precalc. I have made A's in every math class up to this point. Every thing I learned I learned by doing the homework, using on line video khan academy & tutor. His test were medium hard but he grades extremely hard and gives quizs that are hard to past would not recomend.

I took him for calc 3. I have made A's and b's in every math class up to this point. Every thing I learned i learned by doing the homework (2 binders full) if class was not mandatory i woulndt have gone. His test were medium hard but he grades extremely hard and gives quizs that are hard to past would not recomend.

Dr. Xu is awesome. He knows the material quite well, and it shows. He teaches pretty slowly so everyone can grasp everything, which can be frustrating if you get it. His accent is pretty thick and hard to understand at times, but he is a great teacher and definitely worth taking.

Dr. Xu is always on schedule. I do advice to read before class since his accent is a bit heavy; but with pre-reading his lectures are pretty good. Overall good teacher and fair grader. His exams were also pretty fair and he ALWAYS includes bonus problems for extra credit. However, he won't give you points for faulty/non-mathematical proofs!

Best math professor I've had. He's prepared for every class and makes you feel prepared for your homework. He keeps problems very neat and clean on the board which helps keep your notes organized and easy to refer to. This is the last math class I have to take, but if I had to take another I would definitely take Dr. Xu.

Professor Xu is a really good math teacher. He is very organized when doing problems and is always prepared for class. He has an accent, which is easy to understand, but can be funny sometimes too. Good personality and sense of humor. Do the homework and make sure you understand it and you'll make an A.

Dr. Xu is very helpful and understanding, that coupled with the fact that Calculus I is not hard makes for an easy class. Aside from that, tests are extremely fair and resemble notes and homework. He's a pretty down to earth teacher, I would recommend to take him.
Great teacher with great personality. I learned a lot in his class. His tests are very fair. As long as you come to class and take notes, you will be good.

You will get past the chinese accent he has. He is a great teacher and works hard to keep everyone up to speed in the class. He makes the effort so if you make an effort you can do well. He works hard on his website also to put every detail of his grading online. Every question on the tests, attendence, and hw are all well catalogued.
Without a doubt, the best math teacher at SPSU! Extremely nice, quick with grading and very fair! He gives you many chances to boost your grade.
great professor, make the class easier. The last math I took was 2 years ago, and I have no problem withthis class. Take his class if you could.
One of the better math profs. I've had. Easy to understand. Grades very leniently.  Do all the homework, study past exams, quizzes and you're guaranteed to get an A!

At first he is hard to understand, but you get use to it. He does take up the homework so make sure you do it. It takes a big chunk of your grade. He knows what he is doing and sometimes goes into more detail than most would like. His tests are the same questions as his older tests, just diff. #'s. Study older test/quizes and do homewrk to pass.

Xu is somewhat difficult to understand at first, but once you get used to him its not a problem. The class is hard, but he is very fair and will give you every opportunity to help yourself... so TAKE IT!

very very good teacher if u study just a little u will make an A in this class. the only bad thing is he collects   homework.otherwise this guy is really a good teacher. i would recommend him to everyone.great guy

Very good teacher knows his stuff. He is willing to help but sometimes he does not understand what you are asking.  Tests and quizzes are very easy (curves “If necessary”) do the practice test and you should make an A

You may not get much from his lectures (extremely hard to understand) but his tests are fair (straight from the homework) and he's a fair grader (gives lots of partial credit).  Overall, I'd recommend him you're comfortable learning on your own.
Overall a good professor. Very hard to understand for awhile which can be frustrating but the exams are from the homework which is good. The main thing is just do all the work and you will be fine

Great teacher, organized, exams are from hw and gives partial credit, submit review of section before tests and get 5% towards that test. He does collect hw and grade it however..just do it and get a good grade.
He is a really good teacher. Explains everything and test and quizzes are easy. I would recommend him to everyone.
good professor and the exams are quite easy.  most from hw problems and stuff.  thick accent but you get used to it after a while
Thick accent sometimes makes him hard to understand, but he's a very good teacher otherwise
Good professor overall. Quite helpful though can be difficult to understand on occasion due to very thick accent. However, notes are quite clear.
